revised_title: Phosphorus-Based Diatomic Bases: Theory and Experimental Findings
tldr: The author, Augustus William Hofmann, explores the formation of diatomic bases, specifically focusing on phosphorus-based compounds. He discusses the reaction between triethylphosphine and dibromide of ethylene, detailing the experimental process and the resulting products. This research contributes to the understanding of diatomic compounds and their potential applications in chemistry.
